FuncDef: The reset evpn vpn-instance mac-duplication command clears the suppression state of MAC routes. The reset evpn vpn-instance mac-duplication command clears the suppression state of MAC routes. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: reset evpn vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> mac-duplication [ bridge-domain <bd-id> ] [ mac-address <mac-address> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an EVPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.
The name must be the same as the BD ID.

Specifies a BD in which the suppression state of MAC routes is to be cleared.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.

Specifies a MAC route whose suppression state is to be cleared.
The value is a 12-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of H-H-H. Each H is 4 digits. If an H contains fewer than 4 digits, the left-most digits are padded with zeros. For example, e0 is displayed as 00e0.
